name: The Headsman (Fighter 8  Weapon Master 7  Champion of Torm 25)
author: Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
[EDIT - nevermind.  As several have pointed out, Dwarf works out much better for this combo, so I'm rebuilding him and will post as a new build since there will be more differences than I realized].

Played HOTU for the first time using a Dwarven War Axe and - lo and behold - one dropped with the Vorpal property (which I don't recall seeing/using since my PNP days 40 years ago).  After looking it up, I start wondering what would it look like if a character had to make 2 different saves - fortitude (against DevCrit) and reflex (against Vorpal) at the same time?  With 2 days to kill on a business trip, I then created and played The Headsman.  Leveled up through SOU/HOTU and the Sands of Fate trilogy.  

I know the class combo has been done to death . . . but even with a low-threat range crit weapon like the Dwarven Waraxe, coupling it with a vorpal property (the one in the game has a DC of 18 vs Reflex), Dev Crit (DC 42 vs Fort), Overwhelming Crit - anything that's not crit immune will die quickly.  For the crit immune - the Waraxe is 1-10, +11 (STR), +6 (WS/EWS), and the IKD Discipline Check is 46 against medium sized opponents (42 vs. large, 38 vs. huge).

IF potion/items are available to buff CHA, he becomes a formidable duelist with +11 to attack, damage & saves for CHA modifier rounds. 

The one thing I'd like to improve is the Will save, but I don't see what I'd give up, except for possibly a Great Strength or two.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A straight up melee warrior with a high AB and very good saves.
It is interesting to see all those x-classed skills. There is no skills schedule in your post. Do you take them every other level and with all three classes?

The dwarven war axe led me to think that it would be interesting to see how this build works with Dwarf. You will earn 4 buy points if you keep Con at 16. Spend one on Int 14 for the extra skill and the other three on Str 17 to free up an epic Great Str feat you can spend on what you want. There shouldn't be any xp penalty with these classes. So what you are left with are the dwarven  racial benefits at the cost of Cha 6, meaning a potential hit to the duration of Divine wrath.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Speaking as an inveterate meleer, I like this one! I don't see a problem with the Will save at all - 35 is damned excellent for a fighter-type.

I also like Mick's suggestion of dwarf. You keep the same number of skill points with an INT of 14 (a shame there's no room for Spot), and one extra epic feat. Pre-epic, you'd have to sacrifice one feat as non-human, but Toughness is something of a luxury anyway, so that's easily accommodated.

And Mick's right: we do really need a skills schedule. Sorry!
